body:
I'm having a look at this one.

From what I can see the issue is not new but it uses to not be reported as a failing exception.

@mcollovati yeah, there are a few places like that but, what's a bit puzzling is having the Maven API not returning a directory for a `getProjectDirectory()` call.

I'm having a closer look as we speak.
OK, so the issues are all in our code, which is cool (and not surprising). I'm testing a patch.
@gsmet Thanks for promptly looking into this issue üôá‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

issue.title: Fix bootstrap when module is pointing to POM file directly

labels.name: area/devtools
labels.description: Issues/PR related to maven, gradle, platform and cli tooling/plugins

issue.body:
Also make sure the Map cache in WorkspaceLoader is consistently referencing the POM files.

Note that I stumbled upon another limitation: the app artifact requires a strict pom.xml as assumptions are hardcoded in
LocalProject#locateCurrentProjectPom().
I haven't fixed that one as it probably requires a lot more changes.

I added a test to make sure we don't regress on this.

Fixes #50571

body:
I think https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/pull/50576 is the proper fix.

It was a bit more involved than your initial proposal but you were definitely on the right track :).

repository.name: platform
repository.description: Vaadin platform 10+ is a Java web development platform based on Vaadin web components.  If you don't know to which repository your bug report should be filed, use this and we'll move it to the right one.

body: @gsmet Is there any chance the fix will be back-ported to 3.27 LTS branch? If so, what could be an estimated date for 3.27.1?

@mcollovati I added the PR to the backports to consider so we will consider it (and I think we will include it).

For the schedule, see: https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/wiki/3.27-LTS-Release-Planning#3271-lts
